meanings.definition: In an arrogant or haughty manner.
meanings.sent1: She walked uppishly, looking down on everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: He spoke uppishly, believing he was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent3: The cat sauntered uppishly past the dogs, feeling superior.
meanings.sent4: The eagle soared uppishly in the sky, surveying its domain.
meanings.sent5: The queen waved uppishly to her adoring subjects from the balcony.

meanings.sent1: Her uppishly demeanor made others feel small.
meanings.sent2: The uppishly student always thought he knew better than the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The uppishly cat refused to play with the other pets.
meanings.sent4: The uppishly mountain stood tall among the surrounding peaks.
meanings.sent5: The uppishly boss never praised his employees for their hard work.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a snobbish or condescending way.
meanings.sent1: The uppishly lady turned her nose up at the simple food.
meanings.sent2: He gave an uppishly smile, thinking he was above everyone else.
meanings.sent3: The uppishly couple only socialized with people of high status.
meanings.sent4: Her uppishly remarks made others feel inferior.
meanings.sent5: The uppishly fashion designer dismissed all other styles as inferior.
